alert.note: Alert for Clay; Jackson; Lee; Owsley (Kentucky) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued September 11 at 1:58PM EDT by NWS Jackson
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of Owsley, southeastern Jackson, south central Lee and north central Clay Counties through 230 PM EDT... At 158 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Mummie, or 7 miles southeast of McKee, moving northeast at 30 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 30 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. This strong thunderstorm will be near... Island City around 205 PM EDT. Endee, Sturgeon, Travellers Rest, Blake, Vincent, Wild Dog, Delvinta and Earnestville around 210 PM EDT. Scoville, Major, Conkling, Taff, Ida May and Trixie around 215 PM EDT. Other locations in the path of this storm include Booneville, Turin, Levi, Southfork, Pebworth, Ricetown, Gobbard, Sebastian, Chestnut Gap, Eversole, Stay, Cowcreek, Lower Buffalo, Enoch, Corgleton, Lerose and Grass. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.
